fields.description:
Earlier today I was creating aliases for various accounts and I had a very long one (eg: frank@WEBHOST.company.com) and I was unable to see the whole name on the commits page so I clicked on the revision number and even though I have mostly blank space the name was still shortened so I couldn't read it. So I had to go find the person an ask what his author name was.\\
This also wouldn't be a probelm if you suggested aliases from a list of people who had committed but didn't have accounts.
fields.summary: Author name too short in commit/specific revision page (BB-2836)

fields.description:
With an imported Git repository the Commits Search function never returns any results.

== Steps ==

h1. Go to the Commits browser, e.g. https://bitbucket.org/rmwcs/sequin/changesets
h1. Enter a search term using a word from one of the commit descriptions.
== Expected==

Commits matching search shown.

== Actual ==

//"No commits match your search query."// is shown.
fields.summary: Search commits not working for Git (BB-2831)

fields.description:
Hello!

When at <account>/<project>/src/ it does not display what the current revision ID is. If you go to <account>/<project>/src/<revision_id> you can pull it from the URL but again, nowhere on the page. It would be nice to see the revision ID you're looking at in the page itself. Thanks!

-jag
fields.summary: Source view does not display what revision ID it is

fields.description:
try <<changeset xxxxx>>, where xxxxx is the commit sha1, you get a "wiki macro error"

The "Issues" listener on the repository doesn't work either, i'd like to be able to have issues fixed by "fixe #XXX" in my commit messages.
fields.summary: issue tracker doesn't support git repositories (BB-2827)

fields.description:
Hi,

Id like to add ssh deploy keys to my private git repositories. So that I am able to pull branches directly from my servers.

These deploy keys should only have read access and are configured within each repository (not within the account).

A workaround would be to create a deploy account which only has read access. This would work but seem to be less clean to me.

Thanks\\
Thomas
fields.summary: SSH Deploy Keys (BB-67)
Git SSH clone link href specifies the wrong SSH user (BB-2830)

fields.description: I was following a private repositories and a few day ago I got out of the project, now for me access to these repositories is denied and there is no ways to unfollow them. I get all activity of these repositories to my dashboard, heart-click not working
fields.summary: Can't unfollow private repositories (BB-2829)

fields.description: Hey, I have client projects I currently host on trac, where I let the client deal with the issue tracker and wiki, but don't allow them to see the source code. I'd love to be able to do this on bb.org so I can just get the clients to pay for the private repo and use it for project issue tracking etc :)
fields.summary: Allow ACLs on repos/issuetracker/wiki

fields.description:
Tried importing a git repo but hit 'enter' before I was able to put in the authorization username/password.

So now its hanging on import.

I can't delete it, since I can't get to the admin screen for it, since it always just goes to the "importing" screen - which is hanging.
fields.summary: Git Import Hanging at 80% due to missing authorization credentials

fields.description: The count of followers of one of my repos is incorrect, it says three but there is only one. If I am misunderstanding it seems misleading maybe.
fields.summary: Icon count incorrect

fields.description:
Hi,\\
Tiny issue with a link to bitbucket user.

* Given I'm on my "Username Aliases" page (http://code.hoborglabs.com/hoborg-commons/admin/committers)
* When I click on my user link (http://code.hoborglabs.com/hoborglabs)
* Then I should go to code.hoborglabs.com (?)
* And I should not see 404 page
fields.summary: Link to bitbucket user broken on "Username aliases" when using own domain CNAME (BB-2828)

fields.description: If I follow issue X and it is marked as a duplicate of issue Y, then I think it would make sense if I would automatically begin following issue Y too.
fields.summary: Copy followers when an issue is marked as a duplicate (BB-2826)

fields.description:
Hello,

I'm migrating my private repos from github and created 2 repos in bitbucket, move sources there, everything worked just fine. Then I noticed "import project" button and decided to give it a try. I imported two more projects from github (great stuff!). When I click on Repositories (Explore Dashboard Repositories) I don't see imported projects only those 2 which I created by hand. However I can see them if I hover on Repositories link. They are in "Recently viewed" and "Recently updated" sections. Thats quite weird.

br,\\
Sergiy
fields.summary: Imported repos don't appear in Repositories (BB-2824)

fields.description:
Wiki macro error: Either directory does not exist or no files found.\\
Used\\
{{{\\
#!php

<<toc / 3>>\\
}}}\\
syntax\\
It worked before.
fields.summary: Wiki TOC macro error

fields.description:
The currently selected branch isn't shown anywhere on the source browser.

*Steps*

h1. Go to the source browser, e.g., https://bitbucket.org/pypy/pypy/src
h1. Click on one of the branches in the branches menu
*Expected*

* The source browser at the revision of that branch is shown.
* The selected branch name is highlighted somewhere.

*Actual*

* The source browser at the revision of that branch is shown.

Perhaps we can show the branch name in the branches menu itself, near the ">>".
fields.summary: Selected branch not shown in the source browser (BB-2813)

fields.description:
Using chrome 14.0.835.186 on ubuntu. I setup a new git repository and had someone fork it while still empty. They then pushed to their fork and sent me a pull request.

When I view the pull request the bottom of the screen (after the "Add Comment" link) just refreshes my repository overview over and over again.

I also got 21 messages in my inbox for the pull request, but that's probably a separate bug from the request creation. The other collaborator told me that his chrome was "going nuts at the bottom of the screen" when he created the request.

Repo is https://bitbucket.org/tctimmeh/snacksrgood
fields.summary: Git pull request view in chrome refreshes constantly (BB-2819)

fields.description:
hi, when i try to clone my new git repository i get this error:

fatal: https://gianni78@bitbucket.org/gianni78/suerte.git/info/refs download error - The requested URL returned error: 401

Can you help me?\\
thanks
fields.summary: git clone error 401

fields.description:
If I try to log in using a OpenID on a custom domain, I'm redirected to the bitbucket.org home page.  The cookies for my custom domain aren't set.

Can only log in using login/password.
fields.summary: OpenID not working on custom domains

fields.description:
Thank you for providing git support to bitbucket.

However, I think that you should be aware that now people will be able to use software like sparkleshare to make massive use of the limitless repositories that you provide.

For example, see my post at: http://bioinfoblog.it/2011/10/bitbucket-sparkleshare-home-made-limitless-dropbox/

Can you please clarify whether this usage is against your terms of usage, and whether you are happy with it?

Thanks
fields.summary: sparkleshare + bitbucket (git) -> home made dropbox

fields.description:
The clone process of a private repository from github runs indefinitely and there is no way to stop it, destroy the project or do anything to resolve the issue manually that I can see.

No way for me to use the bitbucket service if I can't acces the repo...

Same as BCLOUD-3083
fields.summary: repository clones indefinitely

fields.description:
Hi,

I am trying to import my svn repositories to a new git repository on bitbucket. The problem I have is that I can not choose a git repository and all the files are imported to a new HG repository.

# Can I change a HG repository to a Git repository?
# Can I import directly into a new Git repository?

Thank you,\\
Dragosh
fields.summary: Import SVN to new Git repository (BB-2505)

fields.description:
Hi,

I think it would be smart if you added a {{{X-Bitbucket-Repository}}} header to emails sent out. It should contain the {{{$USER/$REPO}}} path to the repository that triggered the mail.

That way it would be easy to filter mails based on the source repository. As it is now, we'll have to filter based on a {{{Subject}}} header that looks something like this:\\
{{{\\
Subject: New issue $N in $REPO: ...\\
}}}\\
That format looks like it's subject to change and it could be ambiguous if I follow several projects with a repository named {{{$REPO}}}. Since people like to name their repos "stable", "devel", and similar, this is not so far fetched.
fields.summary: Email headers to make it easy to filter mails

fields.description:
Github uses jekyll to generate user/project pages. It is a very useful feature, because you can have your personal/project blog and its source in your repository, and posting to it is as simple as adding a new text file (in markdown/textile).

In order for Bitbucket to host a user page (username.bitbucket.org), the file index.html has to be in the root directory of the repository. So if one wants to create a similar solution on Bitbucket, one has to generate the site with jekyll every time before posting, and even so, jekyll has to be modified, because the original version cannot manage a configuration where the jekyll source directory (eg. '/jekyll') is inside the desination directory (where index.html will be, '/').

It would be very nice if a simple solution could be used, just like in Github.
fields.summary: It would be nice to have jekyll to host user pages (BB-2817)

fields.description:
Hi,

We're planning on using BB with one master account creating all our private repositories and giving developers access to them.

The thing is, even if one has access to a repository, since it's not his, it doesn't appear anywhere except in the feed (which get pushed down when other things happens) or in the recent repositories (same issue).

This means the only way to list theses repositories is by going to the master account page.

It would be great if we could see all repositories we have access to in the repositories page along with ours.

Thanks,\\
Hugues
fields.summary: List of accessible private repositories (BB-2821)

fields.description:
Would it be possible to add a button to allow you to download a certain file or folder (from a selected revision) while browsing the source?

This would mean we no longer have to clone everything if we just need to get a few raw files / folders.
fields.summary: Add a button for each folder or file to download from certain revision (BB-2816)

fields.description: I reduced the size of my browser window so that I could only see the left half of the bitbucket dashboard page. When I scrolled over to the right side, the title bar had been messed up. (It had resized to the size of my browser window, even though the page size hadn't changed.)
fields.summary: Title bar doesn't render fully on smaller screen sizes (BB-2814)

fields.description:
Hi,

It's awesome that you've decided to support Git!\\
Since Assembla was the only free private Git hosting service, can you please add support for importing private Git repos from Assembla? I'd like to move all my public and private repos to BB!!

-Joseph
fields.summary: Please add support for importing from Assembla (BB-2812)

fields.description: I attempted to import my repository from Github but was unable to do so using any of the URLs I could determine for the repository.  After attempting to connect without my username and password to my private repo, the github importer remains stuck at 80% and still acts as though it's occupying my account.  Every time I load the repo I'm confronted to begin the import process and blocked from removing the repository manually.
fields.summary: Importing Repos from Github with incorrect auth details hang the importer (BB-2820)

fields.description:
I just created a few more repositories, and they appear fine in the dropdown, but not when I click "Repositories" in the menu. Take a look at the screenshot!\\
Thanks guys, great to see you finally moving to GIT! :)
fields.summary: Not all my repos appear in the "My Repositories" view

fields.description:
It would be nice to have an organization context (much like there is on github) to organize a company's repositories, groups/teams, etc\\
This can be achieved by creating an user for the company, but it doesn't feel right, it requires you to log out/log in for every change.\\
I would love an 'organization' feature with an easy context change button :)
fields.summary: Company/Organization Context (BB-53)

fields.description:
Page: https://bitbucket.org/repo/import

When attemping to import an SVN repository, it seems the only valid URLs must be prefixed with http or https.

Per SVN documentation, urls starting with svn: is also a valid prefix that indicates to connect on a different port (port 3690, fyi).

My current repository is located on such an url, and therefore I can't import it.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Importer returns "no repository exists" error message instead of "requires auth" (BB-2823)

fields.description: After I enable Pricate Ticket System, if I click the tab for issues it says issue tracking is not enabled.
fields.summary: Enable Private Ticket System

fields.description:
The "Remove service" button seems to not exist as shown in http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Setting+Up+the+Bitbucket+Superfeedr+Service

The only option on https://bitbucket.org/tetleyt/webrp/admin/services is "Save settings" (of which there aren't actually any  settings).

Tested on Firebox & Safari.
fields.summary: Unable to remove Superfeedr service

I can't clone my git repository over ssh:\\

Cloning into test...\\
Warning: Permanently added the RSA host key for IP address '207.233.240.181' to the list of known hosts.\\
Permission denied (publickey).\\

fields.description:
the link "Importing code into your Bitbucket repository" ask me to create a user, which I have now, then failed:\\
You cannot view this page\\
Page level restrictions have been applied that limit access to this page.\\
url: http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=259358821
fields.summary: Documentation on popular help topics is not readable

fields.description:
I just set up a Git repo (booksavr.git), and forked it from my organizations (elmcitylabs) account into dlo/booksavr.git.

I made a small change to test out the pull requests, and successfully (at least I thought) merged into into the main branch.

However, when trying to pull down from the new tree, I get this error:

{{{\\
$ git pull origin master\\
fatal: loose object 70e3b32923b05bbe280ca1226c4e4acb8b1ed54f (stored in ./objects/70/e3b32923b05bbe280ca1226c4e4acb8b1ed54f) is corrupt\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
}}}

I then tried to inspect this object--but then realized this was on the remote, so I couldn't. My next line of attack was to simply bypass the pull request altogether and just force the push into the main repo.

This is what happened:

{{{\\
$ git push origin master --force\\
Counting objects: 762, done.\\
Delta compression using up to 2 threads.\\
Compressing objects: 100% (269/269), done.\\
Writing objects: 100% (701/701), 1.05 MiB, done.\\
Total 701 (delta 442), reused 679 (delta 423)\\
remote: fatal: loose object 70e3b32923b05bbe280ca1226c4e4acb8b1ed54f (stored in /data/netapp02/netapp02_sas01_09/data/d-859/r-387859//objects/70/e3b32923b05bbe280ca1226c4e4acb8b1ed54f) is corrupt\\
remote: fatal: loose object 70e3b32923b05bbe280ca1226c4e4acb8b1ed54f (stored in /data/netapp02/netapp02_sas01_09/data/d-859/r-387859//objects/70/e3b32923b05bbe280ca1226c4e4acb8b1ed54f) is corrupt\\
remote: fatal: loose object 70e3b32923b05bbe280ca1226c4e4acb8b1ed54f (stored in /data/netapp02/netapp02_sas01_09/data/d-859/r-387859//objects/70/e3b32923b05bbe280ca1226c4e4acb8b1ed54f) is corrupt\\
remote: bb/acl: dlo is allowed. accepted payload.\\
remote: fatal: loose object 70e3b32923b05bbe280ca1226c4e4acb8b1ed54f (stored in /data/netapp02/netapp02_sas01_09/data/d-859/r-387859//objects/70/e3b32923b05bbe280ca1226c4e4acb8b1ed54f) is corrupt\\
remote: fatal: loose object 70e3b32923b05bbe280ca1226c4e4acb8b1ed54f (stored in /data/netapp02/netapp02_sas01_09/data/d-859/r-387859//objects/70/e3b32923b05bbe280ca1226c4e4acb8b1ed54f) is corrupt\\
remote: fatal: loose object 70e3b32923b05bbe280ca1226c4e4acb8b1ed54f (stored in /data/netapp02/netapp02_sas01_09/data/d-859/r-387859//objects/70/e3b32923b05bbe280ca1226c4e4acb8b1ed54f) is corrupt\\
To git@git.elmcitylabs.com:elmcitylabs/booksavr.git

* 70e3b32...0ba2040 master -> master (forced update)\\
}}}
fields.summary: [Git] Accepting pull request corrupts repository

fields.description:
I imported one of my private projects into Bitbucket from Github, and I'm very happy with the new git integration on BB. But I was disappointed to see that the import did not import my issue queue from Github. I realize that this is a new thing for BB but I don't feel like I can completely move my projects off Github until I can move my issue queue over.

Thanks!!

--Steve

I setup a CNAME on wallrazer.com that points to bitbucket.org. BB says that the domain does not resolve, though I can ping the hostname without an issue:

{{{\\
titan[~]> ping code.wallrazer.com\\
PING bitbucket.org (207.223.240.181): 56 data bytes\\
64 bytes from 207.223.240.181: icmp_seq=0 ttl=53 time=65.572 ms\\
64 bytes from 207.223.240.181: icmp_seq=1 ttl=53 time=69.725 ms\\
64 bytes from 207.223.240.181: icmp_seq=2 ttl=53 time=67.172 ms\\
64 bytes from 207.223.240.181: icmp_seq=3 ttl=53 time=66.595 ms\\
^C\\
--- bitbucket.org ping statistics ---\\
4 packets transmitted, 4 packets received, 0.0% packet loss\\
round-trip min/avg/max/stddev = 65.572/67.266/69.725/1.531 ms

}}}

Is there something I'm missing?

Thanks

--Steve

ascending order problem.\\

The Tab Order in the Loging Page is wrong  / confusing. Its is\\
name, password, reset Password.\\
It now has happend several times to that that i unintenionally follow the reset password link.  The most common use case for this page is to login. So it really should be username, password, login Button.\\
Using Firefox 6.0.2 ond Max OS X 10.6.8
fields.summary: Taborder in Login Page (BB-2793)

fields.description:
Sorry but I only see revision IDs (not really human-eye-friendly) in commits view! Maybe I miss something?\\
Instead (as you of course well know) Mercurial simply does show also revision number with 'hg log' command. For example:\\
{{{\\
hg log\\
changeset:   2:3d6deb067a1f\\
user:        iacopo\\
date:        Sat Feb 13 11:25:32 2010 +0100\\
summary:     Very cool changes

changeset:   1:a6faceb24e26\\
user:        iacopo\\
date:        Fri Feb 12 14:32:46 2010 +0100\\
summary:     Cool changes

changeset:   0:95e34a05357f\\
user:        iacopo\\
date:        Fri Feb 12 14:28:51 2010 +0100\\
summary:     First commit\\
}}}

I think it was a simple but very useful feature (I setted major priority).\\
Amongst other things, this was the main reason why I left codebase before give it a more deep try and decided to choose BB.\\
Please (re)introduce-it.\\
Thank you.
fields.summary: Where are revision numbers???

fields.description:
Firefox 6.0.2 on Win7

* open wiki page
* click edit
* make some edits
* click preview
* make some edits
* click save
* Boom! "Oops, it seems that this page is being concurrently edited by someone else and we don't perform automatic merging. If concurrent editing is important for you, consider cloning the wiki repo and working offline."
fields.summary: Preview in wiki causes concurrent editing error when saved (BB-2764)

fields.description:
It is sometimes useful to be able to change the name of a project. However, doing this changes the name of the repository, thus everyone using the repo now has to update to the new repo name.

There should be two settings: the name of the project and the repo's name. That way, if you choose an unfortunate repo name initially, you can still use it while changing the project's name.
fields.summary: Decouple repository slug from repository name (BB-461)

fields.description:
When clicking on the admin tab of a project, then modifying "group access", e.g. setting group access to admin, it sends the ajax requests out to modify the settings, but they return 404.

I have attached a screenshot of the group thing, and chrome dev tools showing the failed request.

The specific URL is:\\
https://bitbucket.org/hit/uc-packages-deb/admin\\
as the user "michaelrose" (who is a part of a group with admin access).
fields.summary: Admin group access read/write/admin/delete functions do not work for non-owners of a repository (BB-2727)

fields.description:
The full alert message is:

Oops, it seems that this page is being concurrently edited by someone else and we don't perform automatic merging. If concurrent editing is important for you, consider cloning the wiki repo and working offline.

The problem:

This behaviour is new, unexpected and annoying as I am then unable to Preview the wiki page more than once, making the Preview feature completely useless.
fields.summary: Click Preview twice and alert message insinuates that the wiki page is being concurrently edited by someone else (BB-2726)

fields.description: A few days ago, the email updates we would receive when an issue was created or updated stopped coming.  We are now no longer receiving any emails from our issues.
fields.summary: No email updates for issues are being received

fields.description:
I hope you hear me out. I hope someone with some decision power hears me out.

Right now, Bitbucket is not free. When Bitbucket has functionality that I dislike, I am not free to implement suggestions for you. At best, I can beg and argue with you when you decide that my suggestion is not a good one. If Bitbucket were free, I could go and implement it and show you, "see, this is how it could work, what do you think?" I could have much more leverage with which to help Bitbucket be better if it were free.

I was told that Bitbucket is not free because it is commercial. I do not understand why this is an explanation. Red Hat is free and commercial. Some of the best money I've ever spent. Gitorious is free and commercial despite more directly competing with a behemoth like github. From what we know of their finances, both of these are successful commercial ventures. And they are free.

I am not asking you to give up your trademark, your savoir-faire, your brand image, your hosting, your servers. Ultimately, all of this is what you really sell, just like Red Hat sells support and Gitorious sells support and hosting. I only see you adding value to Bitbucket if you make it free.

Hell, I will *pay* for access to the source. As much as 50, no, 100 USD per month for a premium source access subscription. Make it so that only premium subscribers have read access to the master Bitbucket repository. I will *pay* for the privilege to collaborate with you instead of begging you to make changes and arguing with you when you decide WONTFIX, HOLD, LATER, NOTABUG, CANTREPRODUCE.

Make it AGPL. If I or anyone else decides to run off with the source and make a knockoff site (which, btw, I haven't seen happen with gitorious yet, perhaps you have?), your source won't give us a competitive advantage, because we won't have the service, hosting, trademark, brand name, and support you actually sell. Give me the opportunity to buy another product from you.

As it is stands right now, I am not happy with Bitbucket. I think it has potential, but I can't fix it when it doesn't work. Every user of this site is a developer. Every user is a potential collaborator, moreso than any other kind of software. We hackers also like to hack with our and *on* our tools. We are already writing code. We all give you our source. You don't give us yours. We gave you Mercurial, Python, Pygments, Django. Please give us Bitbucket.

Collaborate with us. Share source like we share it with you. Make it free.
fields.summary: Make Bitbucket free

fields.description:
A pull request from a deleted fork remains in the open state with no way to reject it.

See:

https://bitbucket.org/formencode/official-formencode/pull-request/1/some-bugfixes-for-tickets-on-sfnet
fields.summary: Can not reject a pull request that is from a deleted fork (BB-2695)

fields.description:
I have attempted to upload my public key, id_dsa.pub (file attached).\\
This is rejected as being an invalid key.

I have also tried copy/pasting it line by line into the little box for this purpose.  This was likewise rejected.
fields.summary: Can't upload public key; it's rejected as "invalid" (BB-3096)

fields.description:
Mathematica

Also, I did not see other, but figure I missed it or it had a different name.  Clarification would be great.

Thanks! James
fields.summary: Request for additional programming language in the dropdown box
Include Status in update issue email's subject (BB-2697)

fields.description:
Can I manually specify syntax highlighting per file? Sometimes it's simply impossible to determine the kind of file just by the filename or by a quick inspection of it (e.g. is .h C or C++, is .m Matlab or Octave....) so it would help if I could manually override it for when Pygments gets it wrong.

Now that my Octave highlighting patches have gotten accepted into Pygments, I would like to be able to use them on bb. :-)
fields.summary: Specify syntax highlighting per file

fields.description:
RESOLVED

I see in the issue history that this behavior was discussed in the issue BCLOUD-2936. The problem depends on the web browser. I use Firefox (Iceweasel). I can confirm that Konqueror parses the README.rst OK

Sorry

----
Hello,

I have a README.rst file in one repository of bitbucket and I can see that some text itemized with - are incorrectly parsed with bitbucket if it compared with rst2html tool. I attach two screenshots with the results of my README.rst parsed by bitbucket and by rst2html (with the options -g -t -s --language=es --no-compact-lists --no-compact-field-lists).

As you can see, with nested itemized sections, the bitbucket parser puts the text not in the same line as the item mark.

Is it a bug?

Thanks
fields.summary: Parsing reStructuredText

fields.description:
Hi, apologies if this has been addressed before, but I couldn't find a relevant report. A while ago you had several themes for displaying source code. I believe they were based on Pygments. Now, all of those are gone.

How can I get them back?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Dark themes for viewing source?

fields.description:
The issue/comment text editor has buttons for linking to issues and changesets.

Now that pull requests are first-class citizens with their own numbering, it would make sense to have some syntax for linking to them as well (as in "fixed by <<pull request 123>>".)
fields.summary: Linking to pull requests from issues (BB-2650)

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to categorize projects in a folder/directory-like way for the following reasons:

* *Better organization*: I have like 30 repositories, some are Joomla extensions, some are Symfony plugins, some are websites for clients, some are internal experiments. My home & repository pages feel cluttered.
* ** Easier access control**: Client projects and internal projects. Client projects always have the same set of permissions and same goes for internal projects, but they are different sets of permissions.
* *Friendlier URLs*: I think that maybe it would be more natural to have something like account/clients/client-x/site and account/clients/client-x/store than account/client-x-site and account/client-x-store.
* *Potential Automatic hgsub generation*: Maybe if, say, there is an account/foo repository, there would be a button that says "Add Sub repo", this would ask you the normal stuff to create the new repo and where you want to land it in the parent repo. If, perhaps, you wanted to use an existing one it would just ask you the URL (or Bitbucket path) and where you want to land it.
fields.summary: Nested namespaces for projects

fields.description:
I can't seem to delete this notification:

https://bitbucket.org/account/notifications/read/231603/you-have-hereby-been-granted-write-access-to-sphinx-contrib
fields.summary: Can't delete notification

fields.description:
While I can query for "no responsible", I can't query for empty values for these three properties.

This would be valuable in order to assign them to untriaged bugs.
fields.summary: Cannot query for empty milestone/component/version (BB-2649)
Issue tracker custom queries are broken (BB-2696)

fields.description: When I reject a pull request, I can enter a message, which is great.  I'd like the same (optionally) for acceptance, e.g. to thank the contributor, or to note that I've noticed a bug but will make the fix myself later on.
fields.summary: Allow message when accepting pull request

fields.description:
Hi,\\
it would be nice to have a service that counts how many times a project is cloned (and how many times it is pulled).\\
I just think it would be nice to know if anybody is interested in my project.\\
Or actually uses it ;)

I think this service cannot be written with the current services framework?\\
Because it only considers push events.

Greetings,\\
Alex von Rhein
fields.summary: clone counter service (BB-2582)

fields.description: I should have the option to globally turn off email notifications for my own changes to issues.
fields.summary: Excessive Emails When Creating Tickets

fields.description:
Hi There,  would it be possible that you can provide us with the functionality to customize or add new statuses for issues?  We are in need to have the status "UAT" and "Live"?

Thanks!

Celia
fields.summary: Customize Issue Statuses (BB-2642)

fields.description:
Hi There,  Would it be possible that you can add a functionality where we can customize and add our own statuses for issues e.g. we are in need of adding the status "UAT" and "Live" in order for tracking purposes.

Thanks

Kind Regards\\
Celia
fields.summary: Issue Statuses

fields.description:
Heya,

tried to get Jenkins to work with Bitbucket and failed :(\\
My Jenkins is behind an Apache (eg) at http://jenkins.example.org/jenkins/, so I used that as the endpoint, project and token was set correctly, module left empty. However I did not see _any_ HTTP requests in my logs.

Then I looked at https://bitbucket.org/mahoney/jenkins-bitbucket-broker/src/02ab70aab866/jenkins.py and used the POST Broker with the same url as the Jenkins one would use, which worked fine (so there is no network problem between the machines).

Please fix ;)

Regards

Evgeni
fields.summary: Jenkins Broker not working

fields.description:
In the past the raw view of a HTML file in a repository can be shown as a valid web page in browser.  In this way bitbucket can be used as a simple web page holder.

Since several weeks ago the content-type became text/plain instead of text/html.  Could the content-type be changed back to text/html for HTML files?
fields.summary: Content-type of raw view of HTML files in a repository

fields.description:
I'm engaged in several projects and want to have an overall list of all issues in the different repositories.

It should be the personal dashboard instead of the project overview.\\
It can look like a project issue list.

Important feature see or sort of critical and blocker issues in all repositories.
fields.summary: Overall issue list

fields.description:
I'm new to mercurial & bitbucket (coming from git & github) and I'm trying to use bitbucket for a project.

So far I've got write access to a new //private// bitbucket repository, and I got started by:

h1. cloning
h1. adding my existing project
h1. committing
h1. trying push, I get //authorization failed// via:
==== HTTPS ====\\
{{{\\
$ hg push https://mariusbutuc@bitbucket.org/DB2UAdmin/repo\\
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: mariusbutuc\\
password:\\
pushing to https://mariusbutuc@bitbucket.org/DB2UAdmin/repo\\
searching for changes\\
abort: authorization failed\\
}}}

==== SSH ====\\
{{{\\
$ hg push ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/DB2UAdmin/repo\\
pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/DB2UAdmin/repo\\
searching for changes\\
remote: adding changesets\\
remote: adding manifests\\
remote: adding file changes\\
remote: added 1 changesets with 9664 changes to 9664 files\\
remote: You're not allowed to write to this repository.\\
remote: transaction abort!\\
remote: rollback completed\\
remote: abort: pretxnchangegroup.bb_perm hook failed\\
}}}

also attempted via simple *HTTP*, got similar results as with *HTTPS*.

Extra details:

* python 2.7.1+
* mercurial 1.7.5
* on Ubuntu 11.04

==== How can I get it to work? ====
fields.summary: Pushing to bitbucket: authorization failed

fields.description:
I've found strange age indication in:\\
https://bitbucket.org/stefanrusek/hg-fixutf8/descendants .\\
Two repository 'methane / hg-fixutf8-jp' and 'tinyfish / hg-fixutf8'\\
were not updated for long time, but the page says "updated 2 days ago".
fields.summary: incorrect "updated 2 days ago"

fields.description: In the page to create new issues, the button "create issue" at the right should be hidden. Even if the form is completed, it won't trigger any action and can confuse users expecting it to work as a submit button.
fields.summary: "Create issue" should be hidden in new issues form

fields.description:
Hi guys,

I think it would be greate to have project activity charts just like Github (see attachment), what do you think? :P
fields.summary: Project activity chart. (BB-61)

fields.description:
Good morning,

Unfortunately there's no support for in-pages links (anchors) in your version of Creole Markup.

Example:

PDF (Portable Document Format[[#sdendnote1sym|^^i^^]]) is...

[[#sdendnote1anc|i]] Adobe Systems Incorporated. //Glossary of VDP Terms.\//Available: http://www.adobe.com/products/vdp/glossary.html. Last accessed 28th Aug 2011.

Please fix this bug.

Thanks,

Samuel Marks
fields.summary: *Your* Creole Markup doesn't support in-page links (anchors) (BB-2600)

fields.description:
I would be very useful if it was possible to re-assign issues between repositories.

Rationale:

We have got separate repositories for PC software, embedded devices, firmware, etc. All these pieces make one product so it's not always obvious where issues come from. Therefore, an issue is initially raised against one of our repositories (most likely originate from) but if we find the issue is located in different repository we cannot reassign it to the right place. Moving them manually is awkward.
fields.summary: Re-assigning issues between repositories (BB-1599)

fields.description: Hello, i have a problem with Pull requests: i cant cancel(when i cancel i get a window in screenshot) or apply Pull requests. What can i do to fix that im our repository?
fields.summary: Error in dialog for rejecting Pull requests (BB-2601)

fields.description:
A colleague of mine tried to import an existing Mercurial repository today. He entered a SSH URL and gave the username and password...

This didn't work and I remembered that this must be because Bitbucket has no way of supplying the password to SSH (short of posing as a TTY and what not).

So I suggest that you discover this when the form is submitted and give a proper error message.

Additionally: can I enter a local filesystem URL (local on Bitbucket's servers!) and import code from a private repository? Please check this too! :-)
fields.summary: Import existing Mercurial repository over SSH (BB-2603)

fields.description:
I imported a Subversion repository to Bitbucket and my eyes caught this warning in the output:\\
{{{\\
16:39:54 svn: warning: Can't open file '/root/.subversion/servers': Permission denied\\
}}}\\
It suggests that the import job is running as root? That could cause problems if a remotely exploitable bug is found in Subversion.
fields.summary: Importing Subversion repository as root (BB-2602)

fields.description:
I suggest you configure a proper set of CA certificates so that we don't get these errors if we use the "import existing code" option to import a Mercurial repository from, e.g., Google Code:\\
{{{\\
16:35:08 hg import for: https://code.google.com/p/hgsubversion/\\
16:35:08 Cloning https://code.google.com/p/hgsubversion/...\\
16:35:08 warning: code.google.com certificate with fingerprint 56:f6:a9:a9:d2:ed:fd:1a:b2:f9:63:7e:d3:51:ac:56:b3:59:a9:8d not verified (check hostfingerprints or web.cacerts config setting)\\
...\\
}}}
fields.summary: Missing CA certificate list for importer (BB-2592)

fields.description:
I signed up for an account yesterday, around 11:00 pm EST.

I did not receive an email from bit-bucket.

I logged in today at 10:00 am EST, and clicked the "resend confirmation" link.

I then received an email from bitbucket timestamped 12:09 AM.

I clicked the validation link in the email and received this error:\\
"We were unable to confirm your email address. The validation email may have expired."

I have tried "resend confirmation" a few more times but haven't received any other emails.

I'm using a gmail account and using the gmail web interface.  Nothing is in the spam folder.  Below is a copy of the header for the email I did receive.

{{{\\
from	Atlassian Bitbucket sales@mailer.bitbucket.org via bounce.mailer.atlassian.com\\
reply-to	Atlassian Bitbucket [reply-fe5c16737c6d017d7117-1158122_HTML-876643130-132689-5009%40mailer.atlassian.com]\\
to	b...u@gmail.com\\
date	Fri, Sep 16, 2011 at 12:06 AM\\
subject	Welcome to Bitbucket\\
mailed-by	bounce.mailer.atlassian.com\\
}}}
fields.summary: Issue with email confirmation

fields.description:
Hello,

It'd be good if Bitbucket could detect Creole markup in README* files just like Github does regarding to Markdown and README.md, and display it accordingly.

Thanks.

--\\
WBR, Andrew
fields.summary: detect Creole markup in README or README.creole files (BB-1782)

fields.description: It doesn't makes sense.
fields.summary: When looking at your own profile, you can follow and send a message yourself (BB-2587)

fields.description: I have both public and private repositories. However, my Newsfeed by default publishes all commit messages, including those to private repositories. In my case, I would like to keep the existence of a few repositories private, but htis is not possible, because now anyone who reads my RSS feed knows about them.
fields.summary: private repository commit messages appear in (public) RSS feeds

fields.description:
I fail to be able to push to my repository with the error:

--- Error During Push

---Mercurial reported error number 255:

---abort: http authorization required

I am pushing to https://riclf@bitbucket.org/riclf/inemergency

I have also tried https://riclf:password@bitbucket.org/riclf/inemergency

So I go to the bitbucket.org site and try to log into my account, using my Username (riclf) and Password, both of which are correct.  The login fails with multiple tries. So I use my email address (ric@innermagic.com) and the same Password and I get in,

Now, when I look at my account, I can verify that my Username IS riclf (Welcome riclf).  So what's up ?

I cannot use my email address in my push command and my Username is non-functional for purposes of logging in !

The result is that I am not able to Push my project to my repository.

Thanks.

-Ric      ric@innermagic.com
fields.summary: username and email address are not synomonous for login
Wiki editing fails: could not lock repository

fields.description: I guess when the repo name is long, the buttons get pushed down? See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Compare fork / Pull Request buttons misaligned  (BB-2549)

fields.description:
Hi,

Can you change the way readme files are rendered on the "Overview" tab of repositories so that if the file has an "<HTML>" tag at the top, it is rendered as web page, but is pure text other wise?  This should be an easy thing to do and will give people more flexibility in how their repository looks.

Cheers,\\
Matt
fields.summary: html README files

fields.description:
# "Track your issues": Every Bitbucket *projects*

Should be "project"

# "Mercurial-backed wiki": Every Bitbucket project gets *it's* own

Should be "its"
fields.summary: Grammatical issues in bitbucket.org/features (BB-2526)

fields.description:
Please remove .hgtags and .hgignore files from automatically generated tarballs or make this an option. These files are useless outside the version control system, and shouldn't be included into tarballs.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Please remove .hgtags and .hgignore files from automatically generated tarballs (BB-2527)

fields.description: Issue number already makes the url unique and urls like this: https://bitbucket.org/kmike/myproject/issue/331/1fgbdcctaeydmm2d1aokdkzcb8adigbdeeeuk0bzav are ugly. The junky part is ignored anyway and the issue is available as https://bitbucket.org/kmike/myproject/issue/331/ - can you please generate links to the issues without the "1fgbdcctaeydmm2d1aokdkzcb8adigbdeeeuk0bzav"?.
fields.summary: Do not include the issue summary in the URL to the issue (BB-2528)

fields.description:
Dear guys,

I really love this site, as they have the tools I need to work in collaborative way with others.

I have noticed that all views have the same section that shows:

* Line 1: Several links (branches, tags, invite, RSS, fork, etc...)
* Line 2: repository owner / name
* Line 3: repository description
* Line 4: Clone this repository message
* Line 5: Clone this repository link

All this section really occupies a lot of valuable space in regular laptops of 14-15". I think this can be reduced or collapsed to one line, maybe expanded at the beginning and then collapsed by the user.

Best regards,\\\
Jaime.
fields.summary: An entire section in the webpages are really unnecessary all the time

fields.description: When I'm clicking on the issue header and edit it the header doesn't save if I'm just clicking outside the field (after editing of course) but if I press enter everything works fine.
fields.summary: while editing the issue header doesn't save
